tit.e: Prince Nariyoshi (his name can also be read as Narinaga)
tit.cmt: Deleted "Imperial""or"→"his name can also be read as"
統一事項に基づき、Imperial Prince Nariyoshiとし、タイトルのためカッコ文を削除（後の文にいれました)。

sen.j: 成良親王（なりよししんのう / なりながしんのう、嘉暦元年（1326年） - 興国5年/康永3年1月6日 (旧暦)（1344年1月21日））は、南北朝時代 (日本)の後醍醐天皇の皇子である。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Nariyoshi (or Narinaga) (1326 - January 21, 1344) is the prince of the Emperor Godaigo of the Nambokucho era (where two Emperors ruled Japan).
Prince Nariyoshi (1326 - January 21, 1344) was the son of Emperor Godaigo of the Nambokucho (Northern and Southern Courts) era.
sen.cmt: Deleted "Imperial"Deleted "(or Narinaga)" - it seems unnecessary to repeat this throughout the whole article"is"→"was""prince"→"son"Deleted "the""era"→"period""(where two Emperors ruled Japan)"→"(Northern and Southern Courts)" and moved
sen.e: Imperial Prince Nariyoshi (his name can also be read as Narinaga) (1326 - January 29, 1344) was the son of Emperor Godaigo of the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Nariyoshiとし、(his name can also be read as Narinaga)を挿入、「南北朝時代 (日本)」→統一リストの表記に修正January 21→Janyuary 29に変更しました。

sen.j: 母は後醍醐の寵姫阿野廉子。
sen.e: His mother was Renshi ANO, Godaigo's beloved mistress.
His mother was Renshi ANO, Godaigo's favorite concubine.
sen.cmt: "beloved mistress"→"favorite concubine" - mistress sounds like he was having an affair, which is not exactly correct
sen.e: His mother was Renshi ANO, Godaigo's favorite concubine.

sen.j: 恒良親王、義良親王（後村上天皇）の同母兄弟。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi and Imperial Prince Norinaga (who later became Emperor Gomurakami) were his whole, not half, brother.
His brothers were Prince Tsuneyoshi and Prince Norinaga (who later became Emperor Gomurakami).
sen.cmt: Deleted "Imperial" "were his whole, not half, brother"→"His brothers were" and moved
sen.e: His brothers were Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi and Imperial Prince Norinaga (who later became Emperor Gomurakami).
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi, Imperial Prince Norinagaに修正

sen.j: 名前の読みが二種類あることについては、後醍醐天皇皇子の読みを参照。
sen.e: If you are wondering why the kanji used for his name is read in two ways, see how the kanji for other Emperor Godaigo's princes are read.
For reasons why the characters used for his name are read in two ways, see how the characters for Emperor Godaigo's other sons are read.
For reasons why the characters used for his name are read in two ways, see how the characters for Emperor Godaigo's other sons are read.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 元弘3年/正慶2年（1333年）、足利尊氏・新田義貞らにより鎌倉幕府が滅亡し、後醍醐天皇の建武の新政がはじまると、翌建武 (日本)元年（1334年）、兄恒良親王が皇太子に指名され、成良は鎌倉府将軍となり、尊氏の弟である足利直義に奉じられて鎌倉幕府崩壊後の関東地方統治を目的に鎌倉へ下向する。
sen.e: In 1333 when the reign by Kamakura bakuru (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was put to an end by warriors including Takauji ASHIKAGA, Yoshisada NITTA and Kemmu-no-shinsei (new political regime) by Emperor Godaigo started, Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi, his brother, was appointed crown price, and Nariyoshi (or Narinaga) was designated Shogun of Kamakura-fu (the new government's watcher organization placed in Kamakura) and went over to Kamakura while being served by Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, a younger brother of Takauji ASHIKAGA, to rule the Kanto region where the Kamakura bakuru had demised.

In 1333, warriors including Takauji ASHIKAGA and Yoshisada NITTA put to an end to the Kamakura shogunate (Japanese feudal government) and Emperor Godaigo initiated the Kemmu restoration, and in 1334, Prince Tsuneyoshi, Nariyoshi's brother, was appointed crown price, and Nariyoshi was designated Shogun of Kamakura-fu, moving to Kamakura to rule the Kanto region while being served by Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, Takauji's younger brother, following the demise of the Kamakura shogunate.
sen.cmt: Changed word orderDeleted "when""reign by Kamakura bakuru"→"Kamakura shogunate"Deleted "headed by a shogun"Added "and""Kemmu-no-shinsei (new political regime)"→"the Kemmu restoration""started"→"initiated"Added "and in 1334,""he"→"Nariyoshi's brother"Deleted "(or Narinaga)"Deleted "(the new government's watcher organization placed in Kamakura)""and went over"→", moving""a younger brother of Takauji ASHIKAGA"→"Takauji's younger brother""where the Kamakura bakuru had demised"→"following the demise of the Kamakura shogunate"
sen.e: In 1333, warriors including Takauji ASHIKAGA and Yoshisada NITTA put to an end to the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and Emperor Godaigo initiated the Kenmu restoration, and in 1334, Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi, Nariyoshi's brother, was appointed crown price, and Nariyoshi was designated Shogun of Kamakura-fu, moving to Kamakura to rule the Kanto region while being served by Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA, Takauji's younger brother, following the demise of the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: 「鎌倉幕府」→統一リストの表記に修正、Kemmu→Kenmu、Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshiとしました。

sen.j: 翌年の中先代の乱の際に帰京し、一時征夷大将軍となるが、短期間で停止されている。
sen.e: When the Nakasendai-no-ran war broke out in the following year, he returned to Kyoto and was appointed Seii-taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") but dismissed in a short period of time.

When the Nakasendai Rebellion (Nakasendai-no-ran) broke out the following year, he returned to Kyoto and was appointed Seii-taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") but dismissed after only a short period.
sen.cmt: Added "Nakasendai Rebellion" and bracketsDeleted "war", "in""in"→"after only"deleted "of time"
sen.e: When the Nakasendai War broke out the following year, he returned to Kyoto and was appointed Seii-taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") but dismissed after only a short period.
sen.cmt: 中先代の乱→the Nakasendai Warに修正

sen.j: 延元元年/建武3年（1336年）、尊氏によって擁立された光明天皇の皇太子となるが、後に廃される。
sen.e: In 1336, he became the crown prince of Emperor Komyo who had been backed up by Takauji, but later, was overthrown.
In 1336, he became the crown prince of Emperor Komyo, who had been supported by Takauji, but was later overthrown.
In 1336, he became the crown prince of Emperor Komyo, who had been supported by Takauji, but was later overthrown.

sen.j: 古典『太平記』では、兄である恒良親王らとともに毒殺されたと伝えられている。
sen.e: According to The Taiheiki (the Records of the Great Peace), he is said to have poisoned together with his bother, Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi.
According to the historical epic, Taiheiki (the Records of the Great Peace), he is said to have been poisoned together with his brother, Prince Tsuneyoshi.
According to the historical epic, "Taiheiki" (the Records of the Great Peace), he is said to have been poisoned together with his brother, Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshi.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせクォーテーションを追加、Imperial Prince Tsuneyoshiとしました。
